cookingMethod:
1. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside.
3. In the same pan, sauté the onions until translucent.
4. Add the tomatoes and cook until they soften.
5. Add turmeric, salt, and water to make a gravy.
6. Add the fried fish and simmer for a few minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and biryani masala.
2. Cook basmati rice separately and set aside.
3. In a pan, sauté the onions until golden brown.
4. Add the marinated chicken and cook until it is no longer pink.
5. Layer the cooked rice and chicken in a large pot.
6. Cover and cook on low heat until flavors are infused.
7. Serve hot with raita and boiled eggs.

1. Marinate the Hilsa fish with turmeric and salt.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside.
3. In the same pan, add mustard paste, turmeric, and green chilies.
4. Add water and bring it to a boil.
5. Add the fried fish and simmer until the gravy thickens.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Sauté onions and ginger until golden brown.
2. Add garam masala and cook for a minute.
3. Add coconut milk and simmer for a few minutes.
4. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

1. Marinate the beef with spices and salt.
2. Heat oil in a pan and fry onions until golden brown.
3. Add garlic and ginger and cook for a minute.
4. Add the marinated beef and cook until tender.
5. Serve hot with naan or rice.

1. Marinate the mutton with yogurt and biryani spices.
2. Cook basmati rice separately and set aside.
3. In a pan, sauté the onions until golden brown.
4. Add the marinated mutton and cook until tender.
5. Layer the cooked rice and mutton in a large pot.
6. Cover and cook on low heat until flavors are infused.
7. Serve hot with raita and boiled eggs.
